translated: The Collection of Long Discourses 1.1
The Only Son
Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa upāsakassa ekaputtako piyo manāpo kālaṅkato hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa upāsakassa eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ kālaṅkataḥ hoti
translated: Now on that occasion the only son of a certain lay follower had died.

original: Atha kho sambahulā upāsakā allavatthā allakesā divā divassa yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu;
analyzed: atha kho sambahulāḥ upāsakāḥ allavatthāḥ allakesāḥ divā divassa yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu
translated: Then a number of lay followers, their clothes wet and hair wet, went to the Blessed One in the middle of the day

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinne kho
translated: and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, sat to one side.
The Blessed One said to them:

original: “kiṁ nu kho tumhe, upāsakā, allavatthā allakesā idhūpasaṅkamantā divā divassā”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho tumhe upāsakāḥ allavatthāḥ alla kesāḥ idhu upasaṅkamantāḥ divā divassa ati
translated: “Why have you come here, lay followers, your clothes wet and hair wet, in the middle of the day?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, so upāsako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saḥ upāsakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the lay follower said to the Blessed One,

original: “mayhaṁ kho, bhante, ekaputtako piyo manāpo kālaṅkato.
analyzed: mayham kho bhante eka puttakaḥ piyaḥ manāpaḥ kālaṅkataḥ
translated: “My only son, lord, who was dear and beloved to me, has died.

original: Tena mayaṁ allavatthā allakesā idhūpasaṅkamantā divā divassā”ti.
analyzed: tena mayam alla vatthāḥ alla kesāḥ idhu upasaṅkamantā divā divassā ati
translated: That’s why we’ve come here, our clothes wet and hair wet, in the middle of the day.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, the Blessed One, having known the significance of that, on that occasion exclaimed:
“Those who are infatuated with the pleasure of what is likable,
The gods and humans in many ways,
Being overcome, being emaciated,
Go into the power of the King of Death.

original: Ye ve divā ca ratto ca,
analyzed: ye ve divā ca ratto ca
translated: But those who, day and night,
Being heedful, give up what is likable,
They dig up the root of suffering,
The flesh of Death, so hard to cross.”
The seventh.
